heading: Births
txt: Jackson Wang, Hong Kong rapper

entities.title: Jackson Wang
entities.description: Jackson Wang is a Hong Kong rapper, singer and dancer based in China. He is the founder of record label Team Wang, and is the creative director and lead designer for fashion brand Team Wang Design. He is active in mainland China as a solo artist and television host. He is a member of the South Korean boy group Got7.

heading: Births
txt: Jonathan Drouin, Canadian ice hockey player

entities.title: Jonathan Drouin
entities.description: Jonathan Drouin is a Canadian professional ice hockey forward for the Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League (NHL). After a stellar 2012–13 season with the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League (QMJHL)'s Halifax Mooseheads, in which he was named.CHL Player of the Year and won the Memorial Cup, Drouin was selected by the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, third overall, of the 2013 NHL E

heading: Births
txt: Matt Renshaw, English-Australian cricketer

entities.title: Matt Renshaw
entities.description: Matthew Thomas Renshaw is an English-born Australian international cricketer who plays for Queensland. He scored his maiden first-class century on 6 December 2015 in the 2015–16 Sheffield Shield against New South Wales. He made his List A debut for the National Performance Squad against India A on 27 August 2016.

heading: Births
txt: Anna Shcherbakova, Russian figure skater (two-time Russian National Champion - '19 & '20)

entities.title: Anna Shcherbakova
entities.description: Anna Stanislavovna Shcherbakova is a Russian figure skater. She is the 2021 World champion, the 2020 European silver medalist, the 2019 Grand Prix Final silver medalist, the 2019 Skate America champion, the 2019 Cup of China champion, the 2019 CS Lombardia Trophy champion, and a three-time Russian national champion (2019–21). She is currently the second highest ranked ladies' singles skater in the

heading: Deaths
txt: Pertinax, Roman emperor (b. 126)

entities.title: Pertinax
entities.description: Pertinax was a Roman soldier and politician who ruled as Roman emperor for the first three months of 193. He succeeded Commodus to become the first emperor during the tumultuous Year of the Five Emperors.

heading: Deaths
txt: Hatsusebe, Japanese princess

entities.title: Princess Hatsusebe
entities.description: Princess Hatsusebe  was a Japanese princess during the Asuka period and the Nara period.

heading: Deaths
txt: Arnulf I, count of Flanders

entities.title: Arnulf I, Count of Flanders
entities.description: Arnulf I, called the Great, was the first Count of Flanders.

entities.title: County of Flanders
entities.description: The County of Flanders was a historic territory in the Low Countries.

heading: Deaths
txt: Flodoard, Frankish canon and chronicler

entities.title: Flodoard
entities.description: Flodoard of Reims was a Frankish chronicler and priest of the cathedral church of Reims in the West Frankish kingdom during the decades following the dissolution of the Carolingian Empire. His historical writings are major sources for the history of Western Europe, especially France, in the early and mid-tenth century.

entities.title: Canon (priest)
entities.description: A canon is a member of certain bodies subject to an ecclesiastical rule.

entities.title: Chronicle
entities.description: A chronicle is a historical account of events arranged in chronological order, as in a time line. Typically, equal weight is given for historically important events and local events, the purpose being the recording of events that occurred, seen from the perspective of the chronicler. A chronicle which traces world history is a universal chronicle. This is in contrast to a narrative or history, in

heading: Deaths
txt: Ordulf, Duke of Saxony (b. 1022)

entities.title: Ordulf, Duke of Saxony
entities.description: Ordulf was the duke of Saxony from 1059, when he succeeded his father Bernard II, until his death. He was a member of the Billung family.

heading: Deaths
txt: Saint Stephen Harding, founder of the Cistercian order

entities.title: Stephen Harding
entities.description: Stephen Harding was an English-born monk and abbot, who was one of the founders of the Cistercian Order. He is honoured as a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.

heading: Deaths
txt: Emperor Go-Toba of Japan (b. 1180)

entities.title: Emperor Go-Toba
entities.description: Emperor Go-Toba  was the 82nd emperor of Japan, according to the traditional order of succession. His reign spanned the years from 1183 through 1198.

heading: Deaths
txt: Valdemar II of Denmark (b. 1170)

entities.title: Valdemar II of Denmark
entities.description: Valdemar II, called Valdemar the Victorious or Valdemar the Conqueror, was the King of Denmark from 1202 until his death in 1241. The nickname Sejr is a later invention and was not used during the King's own lifetime. Sejr means victory in Danish.

heading: Deaths
txt: William de Ferrers, 5th Earl of Derby (b. 1193)

entities.title: William de Ferrers, 5th Earl of Derby
entities.description: William III de Ferrers, 5th Earl of Derby of Chartley Castle in Staffordshire, was an English nobleman and major landowner, unable through illness to take much part in national affairs. From his two marriages, he left numerous children who married into noble and royal families of England, France, Scotland and Wales.

heading: Deaths
txt: Pope Martin IV (b. 1220)

entities.title: Pope Martin IV
entities.description: Pope Martin IV, born Simon de Brion, was the head of the Catholic Church and ruler of the Papal States from 22 February 1281 to his death. He was the last French pope to have held court in Rome; all subsequent French popes held court in Avignon.

heading: Deaths
txt: Venturino of Bergamo, Dominican preacher (b. 1304)

entities.title: Venturino of Bergamo
entities.description: Venturino of Bergamo was an Italian Dominican preacher.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Clifford, 9th Baron de Clifford (b. 1435)

entities.title: John Clifford, 9th Baron de Clifford
entities.description: John Clifford, 9th Baron Clifford, 9th Lord of Skipton was a Lancastrian military leader during the Wars of the Roses in England. The Clifford family was one of the most prominent families among the northern English nobility of the fifteenth century, and by the marriages of his sisters John Clifford had links to some very important families of the time, including the earls of Devon. He was orphane

heading: Deaths
txt: Heinrich Glarean, Swiss poet and theorist (b. 1488)

entities.title: Heinrich Glarean
entities.description: Heinrich Glarean was a Swiss music theorist, poet and humanist. He was born in Mollis and died in Freiburg.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sigismund von Herberstein, Austrian historian and diplomat (b. 1486)

entities.title: Sigismund von Herberstein
entities.description: Siegmund (Sigismund) Freiherr von Herberstein was a Carniolan diplomat, writer, historian and member of the Holy Roman Empire Imperial Council. He was most noted for his extensive writing on the geography, history and customs of Russia, and contributed greatly to early Western European knowledge of that area.

heading: Deaths
txt: Magnus, Duke of Holstein (b. 1540)

entities.title: Magnus, Duke of Holstein
entities.description: Magnus of Denmark or Magnus of Holstein was a Prince of Denmark, Duke of Holstein, and a member of the House of Oldenburg. As a vassal of Tsar Ivan IV of Russia, he was the titular King of Livonia from 1570 to 1578.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ivan the Terrible, Russian king (b. 1530)

entities.title: Ivan the Terrible
entities.description: Ivan IV Vasilyevich, commonly known in English as Ivan the Terrible, was the grand prince of Moscow from 1533 to 1547 and the first tsar of all Rus' from 1547 to 1584.

heading: Deaths
txt: Constantijn Huygens, Dutch poet and composer (b. 1596)

entities.title: Constantijn Huygens
entities.description: Sir Constantijn Huygens, Lord of Zuilichem, was a Dutch Golden Age poet and composer. He was secretary to two Princes of Orange: Frederick Henry and William II, and the father of the scientist Christiaan Huygens.

heading: Deaths
txt: Marquis de Condorcet, French mathematician and philosopher (b. 1743)

entities.title: Marquis de Condorcet
entities.description: Marie Jean Antoine Nicolas de Caritat, Marquis of Condorcet, known as Nicolas de Condorcet, was a French philosopher and mathematician. His ideas, including support for a liberal economy, free and equal public instruction, constitutional government, and equal rights for women and people of all races, have been said to embody the ideals of the Age of Enlightenment and Enlightenment rationalism. He

heading: Deaths
txt: Antonio Capuzzi, Italian violinist and composer (b. 1755)

entities.title: Antonio Capuzzi
entities.description: Giuseppe Antonio Capuzzi was an Italian violinist and composer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Petrus Hofman Peerlkamp, Dutch scholar and critic (b. 1786)

entities.title: Petrus Hofman Peerlkamp
entities.description: Petrus Hofman Peerlkamp was a Dutch classical scholar and critic.

heading: Deaths
txt: Solomon Foot, American lawyer and politician (b. 1802)

entities.title: Solomon Foot
entities.description: Solomon Foot was a Vermont politician and attorney. He held numerous offices during his career, including Speaker of the Vermont House of Representatives, State's Attorney for Rutland County, member of the United States House of Representatives, and United States Senator.

heading: Deaths
txt: James Brudenell, 7th Earl of Cardigan, English lieutenant and politician (b. 1797)

entities.title: James Brudenell, 7th Earl of Cardigan
entities.description: Lieutenant-General James Thomas Brudenell, 7th Earl of Cardigan,, styled as Lord Cardigan, was an officer in the British Army who commanded the Light Brigade during the Crimean War. He led the Charge of the Light Brigade at the Battle of Balaclava.

heading: Deaths
txt: George Henry Thomas, American general (b. 1816)

entities.title: George Henry Thomas
entities.description: George Henry Thomas was a United States Army officer and a Union general during the American Civil War, one of the principal commanders in the Western Theater.

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter Andreas Hansen, Danish-German astronomer and mathematician (b. 1795)

entities.title: Peter Andreas Hansen
entities.description: Peter Andreas Hansen was a Danish-born German astronomer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Modest Mussorgsky, Russian pianist and composer (b. 1839)

entities.title: Modest Mussorgsky
entities.description: Modest Petrovich Mussorgsky was a Russian composer, one of the group known as "The Five". He was an innovator of Russian music in the Romantic period. He strove to achieve a uniquely Russian musical identity, often in deliberate defiance of the established conventions of Western music.

heading: Deaths
txt: Edmund Kirby Smith, American general (b. 1824)

entities.title: Edmund Kirby Smith
entities.description: Edmund Kirby Smith was a career United States Army officer who fought in the Mexican–American War. He later joined the Confederate States Army in the Civil War, and was promoted to general in the first months of the war. He was notable for his command of the Trans-Mississippi Department after the fall of Vicksburg to the United States

heading: Deaths
txt: Piet Joubert, South African soldier and politician (b. 1831 or 1834)

entities.title: Piet Joubert
entities.description: Petrus Jacobus Joubert, better known as Piet Joubert, was Commandant-General of the South African Republic from 1880 to 1900. He also served as Vice-President to Paul Kruger from 1881 - 1883. He served in First Boer War, Second Boer War, and the Malaboch War.

heading: Deaths
txt: Édouard Colonne, French violinist and conductor (b. 1838)

entities.title: Édouard Colonne
entities.description: Édouard Juda Colonne was a French conductor and violinist, who was a champion of the music of Berlioz and other eminent 19th-century composers.

heading: Deaths
txt: Albert Pinkham Ryder, American painter (b. 1847)

entities.title: Albert Pinkham Ryder
entities.description: Albert Pinkham Ryder was an American painter best known for his poetic and moody allegorical works and seascapes, as well as his eccentric personality. While his art shared an emphasis on subtle variations of color with tonalist works of the time, it was unique for accentuating form in a way that some art historians regard as modernist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Charles Hubbard, American archer (b. 1849)

entities.title: Charles Hubbard (archer)
entities.description: Charles R. Hubbard was an American archer who competed in the 1904 Summer Olympics. He was born and died in Cincinnati. Hubbard won the silver medal in the team competition. In the Double American round he finished 11th.

heading: Deaths
txt: Joseph-Médard Émard, Canadian archbishop (b. 1853)

entities.title: Joseph-Médard Émard
entities.description: Joseph-Médard Émard was a Canadian Roman Catholic priest, professor, and Archbishop of Ottawa.

heading: Deaths
txt: Katharine Lee Bates, American poet and songwriter (b. 1859)

entities.title: Katharine Lee Bates
entities.description: Katharine Lee Bates was an American professor and author, chiefly remembered for her anthem "America the Beautiful", but also for her many books and articles on social reform, on which she was a noted speaker.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lomer Gouin, Canadian lawyer and politician, 13th Premier of Quebec (b. 1861)

entities.title: Premier of Quebec
entities.description: The Premier of Quebec is the head of government of the Canadian province of Quebec. The current Premier of Quebec is François Legault of the Coalition Avenir Québec, sworn in on October 18, 2018 following the 2018 election.

heading: Deaths
txt: Mahmoud Mokhtar, Egyptian sculptor and educator (b. 1891)

entities.title: Mahmoud Mokhtar
entities.description: Mahmoud Mukhtar was an Egyptian sculptor. He attended the School of Fine Arts in Cairo upon its opening in 1908 by Prince Yusuf Kamal, and was part of the original "Pioneers" of the Egyptian Art movement. Despite his early death, he greatly impacted the realization and formation of contemporary Egyptian art. His work is credited with signaling the beginning of the Egyptian modernist movement, and

heading: Deaths
txt: Marcus Hurley, American basketball player and cyclist (b. 1883)

entities.title: Marcus Hurley
entities.description: Marcus Latimer Hurley was an American cyclist who competed in the early twentieth century. He specialized in sprint cycling and won 4 gold medals in Cycling at the 1904 Summer Olympics and a bronze medal in the 2 mile race.

heading: Deaths
txt: Kavasji Jamshedji Petigara, Indian police officer (b. 1877)

heading: Deaths
txt: Virginia Woolf, English novelist, essayist, short story writer, and critic (b. 1882)

heading: Deaths
txt: Miguel Hernández, Spanish poet and playwright (b. 1910)

entities.title: Miguel Hernández
entities.description: Miguel Hernández Gilabert was a 20th-century Spanish-language poet and playwright associated with the Generation of '27 and the Generation of '36 movements. Born and raised in a family of low resources, he was self-taught in what refers to literature, and struggled against an unfavourable environment to build up his intellectual education, such as a father who physically abused him for spending ti

heading: Deaths
txt: Sergei Rachmaninoff, Russian pianist, composer, and conductor (b. 1873)

entities.title: Sergei Rachmaninoff
entities.description: Sergei Vasilyevich Rachmaninoff was a Russian composer, virtuoso pianist, and conductor of the late Romantic period. The influence of Tchaikovsky, Rimsky-Korsakov, Balakirev, Mussorgsky, and other Russian composers is seen in his early works, later giving way to a personal style notable for song-like melodicism, expressiveness and rich orchestral colours.

heading: Deaths
txt: Stephen Leacock, English-Canadian political scientist and author (b. 1869)

entities.title: Stephen Leacock
entities.description: Stephen P. H. Butler Leacock was a Canadian teacher, political scientist, writer, and humourist. Between the years 1915 and 1925, he was the best-known English-speaking humourist in the world. He is known for his light humour along with criticisms of people's follies.

heading: Deaths
txt: Karol Świerczewski, Polish general (b. 1897)

entities.title: Karol Świerczewski
entities.description: Karol Wacław Świerczewski was a Polish and Soviet Red Army general and statesman. He was a Bolshevik Party member during the Russian Civil War and a Soviet officer in the wars fought abroad by the Soviet Union including the one against Polish as well as Ukrainian Republics and in Republican Spain. In 1939 he participated in the Soviet invasion of Poland again. At the end of World War II in Europe

heading: Deaths
txt: Grigoraș Dinicu, Romanian violinist and composer (b. 1889)

entities.title: Grigoraș Dinicu
entities.description: Grigoraș Ionică Dinicu was a Romanian violin virtuoso and composer of Roma ethnicity. He is most famous for his often-played virtuoso violin showpiece "Hora staccato" (1906) and for making popular the tune Ciocârlia, composed by his grandfather Angheluș Dinicu for "nai". It is rumored that Jascha Heifetz once said that Grigoraș Dinicu was the greatest violinist he had ever heard. In the 1930s he w

heading: Deaths
txt: Jim Thorpe, American football player and coach (b. 1887)

entities.title: Jim Thorpe
entities.description: James Francis Thorpe was an American athlete and Olympic gold medalist. A member of the Sac and Fox Nation, Thorpe became the first Native American to win a gold medal for the United States. Considered one of the most versatile athletes of modern sports, he won two Olympic gold medals in the 1912 Summer Olympics, and played American football, professional baseball, and basketball. He lost his Olym

heading: Deaths
txt: W. C. Handy, American trumpet player and composer (b. 1873)

entities.title: W. C. Handy
entities.description: William Christopher Handy was a composer and musician who referred to himself as the Father of the Blues. Handy was one of the most influential songwriters in the United States. One of many musicians who played the distinctively American blues music, Handy did not create the blues genre but was the first to publish music in the blues form, thereby taking the blues from a regional music style with

heading: Deaths
txt: Hugo Wast, Argentinian author and screenwriter (b. 1883)

entities.title: Hugo Wast
entities.description: Gustavo Adolfo Martínez Zuviría, best known under his pseudonym Hugo Wast, was a renowned Argentine novelist and script writer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Antonius Bouwens, Dutch target shooter (b. 1876)

entities.title: Antonius Bouwens
entities.description: Antonius Hubertus Maria "Antoine" Bouwens was a Dutch sports shooter who competed in the early 20th century in pistol shooting. He participated in Shooting at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris and won a bronze medal with the Dutch pistol team. He also competed at the 1920 Summer Olympics.

heading: Deaths
txt: Clemence Dane, English author and playwright (b. 1888)

entities.title: Clemence Dane
entities.description: Clemence Dane was the pseudonym of Winifred Ashton, an English novelist and playwright.

heading: Deaths
txt: Jack Hoxie, American actor (b. 1885)

heading: Deaths
txt: Dwight D. Eisenhower, American general and politician, 34th President of the United States (b. 1890)

entities.title: Dwight D. Eisenhower
entities.description: Dwight David "Ike" Eisenhower GCS CCLH KC NPk was an American military officer and statesman who served as the 34th president of the United States from 1953 to 1961. During World War II, he served as Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force in Europe, and achieved the rare five-star rank of General of the Army. He was responsible for planning and supervising the invasion of North Africa

entities.title: President of the United States
entities.description: The president of the United States (POTUS) is the head of state and head of government of the United States of America. The president directs the executive branch of the federal government and is the commander-in-chief of the United States Armed Forces.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robert Hunter, American golfer (b. 1886)

entities.title: Robert Hunter (golfer)
entities.description: Robert Edward Hunter was an American amateur golfer who competed in the 1904 Summer Olympics. In 1904, Hunter was part of the American team which won the gold medal. He finished fourth in this competition. In the individual competition he finished 14th in the qualification and was eliminated in the second round of the match play.

heading: Deaths
txt: Donie Bush, American baseball player, manager, and team owner (b. 1887)

entities.title: Donie Bush
entities.description: Owen Joseph "Donie" Bush was an American professional baseball player, manager, team owner, and scout. He was active in professional baseball from 1905 until his death in 1972.

heading: Deaths
txt: Arthur Crudup, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1905)

entities.title: Arthur Crudup
entities.description: Arthur William "Big Boy" Crudup was an American Delta blues singer, songwriter and guitarist. He is best known, outside blues circles, for his songs "That's All Right" (1946), "My Baby Left Me" and "So Glad You're Mine", later recorded by Elvis Presley and other artists.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dorothy Fields, American songwriter (b. 1905)

heading: Deaths
txt: Françoise Rosay, French actress (b. 1891)

heading: Deaths
txt: Richard Arlen, American actor (b. 1898)

entities.title: Richard Arlen
entities.description: Richard Arlen was an American actor of film and television.

heading: Deaths
txt: Eric Shipton, English mountaineer and explorer (b. 1907)

entities.title: Eric Shipton
entities.description: Eric Earle Shipton, CBE, was an English Himalayan mountaineer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Emmett Kelly, American clown and actor (b. 1898)

entities.title: Emmett Kelly
entities.description: Emmett Leo Kelly was an American circus performer, who created the clown figure "Weary Willie", based on the hobos of the Great Depression in the 1930s. According to Charles W. Carey, Jr.:Kelly’s creation of Weary Willie revolutionized professional clowning and made him the country’s most familiar clown. The sad-sack, shuffling antics of his unkempt, downtrodden hobo offered a complete contrast to

heading: Deaths
txt: Dick Haymes, Argentinian-American actor and singer (b. 1918)

entities.title: Dick Haymes
entities.description: Richard Benjamin Haymes was an Argentinian-American actor and singer. He was one of the most popular male vocalists of the 1940s and early 1950s. He was the older brother of Bob Haymes who was an actor, television host, and songwriter.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Giauque, Canadian chemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1895)

entities.title: William Giauque
entities.description: William Francis Giauque was a Canadian-born American chemist and Nobel laureate recognized in 1949 for his studies in the properties of matter at temperatures close to absolute zero. He spent virtually all of his educational and professional career at the University of California, Berkeley.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry is awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences to scientists in the various fields of chemistry. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895, awarded for outstanding contributions in chemistry, physics, literature, peace, and physiology or medicine. This award is administered by the Nobel Foundation, and awarded by t

heading: Deaths
txt: Carmen Dragon, American conductor and composer (b. 1914)

entities.title: Carmen Dragon
entities.description: Carmen Dragon was an American conductor, composer, and arranger who in addition to live performances and recording, worked in radio, film, and television.

heading: Deaths
txt: Marc Chagall, Russian-French painter and poet (b. 1887)

entities.title: Marc Chagall
entities.description: Marc Chagall was a Russian-French artist of Belarusian Jewish origin. An early modernist, he was associated with several major artistic styles and created works in a wide range of artistic formats, including painting, drawings, book illustrations, stained glass, stage sets, ceramics, tapestries and fine art prints.

heading: Deaths
txt: Virginia Gilmore. American actress (b. 1919)

entities.title: Virginia Gilmore
entities.description: Virginia Gilmore was an American film, stage, and television actress.

heading: Deaths
txt: Maria von Trapp, Austrian-American singer (b. 1905)

entities.title: Maria von Trapp
entities.description: Baroness Maria Augusta von Trapp DHS was the stepmother and matriarch of the Trapp Family Singers. She wrote The Story of the Trapp Family Singers, which was published in 1949 and was the inspiration for the 1956 West German film The Trapp Family, which in turn inspired the 1959 Broadway musical The Sound of Music and its 1965 film version.

heading: Deaths
txt: Nikolaos Platon, Greek archaeologist and academic (b. 1909)

entities.title: Nikolaos Platon
entities.description: Nikolaos Platon was a renowned Greek archaeologist. He discovered the Minoan palace of Zakros on Crete.

heading: Deaths
txt: Scott Cunningham, American author (b. 1956)

entities.title: Scott Cunningham
entities.description: Scott Douglas Cunningham was an American writer. Cunningham is the author of several books on Wicca and various other alternative religious subjects.

heading: Deaths
txt: Eugène Ionesco, Romanian-French playwright and critic (b. 1909)

entities.title: Eugène Ionesco
entities.description: Eugène Ionesco was a Romanian-French playwright who wrote mostly in French, and was one of the foremost figures of the French avant-garde theatre in the 20th century. Ionesco instigated a revolution in ideas and techniques of drama, beginning with his "anti play", The Bald Soprano. Ionesco contributed to the beginnings of what is known as the Theatre of the Absurd, which includes a number of plays

heading: Deaths
txt: Shin Kanemaru, Japanese politician, Deputy Prime Minister of Japan (b. 1914)

entities.title: Shin Kanemaru
entities.description: Shin Kanemaru was a Japanese politician who was a significant figure in the political arena of Japan from the 1970s to the early 1990s. He was also Director General of the Japan Defense Agency from 1977 to 1978.

entities.title: Deputy Prime Minister of Japan
entities.description: The Deputy Prime Minister of Japan  is the second highest ranking officer of the executive branch of the government of Japan and a senior member of the Cabinet of Japan. The office of the Deputy Prime Minister is not a permanent position, existing only at the discretion of the Prime Minister.

heading: Deaths
txt: Franco Gasparri, Italian actor (b. 1948)

entities.title: Franco Gasparri
entities.description: Franco Gasparri was an Italian actor.

heading: Deaths
txt: Anthony Powell, English soldier and author (b. 1905)

entities.title: Anthony Powell
entities.description: Anthony Dymoke Powell was an English novelist best known for his 12-volume work A Dance to the Music of Time, published between 1951 and 1975. It is on the list of longest novels in English.

heading: Deaths
txt: Moe Koffman, Canadian flute player, saxophonist, and composer (b. 1928)

entities.title: Moe Koffman
entities.description: Morris "Moe" Koffman, OC was a Canadian jazz saxophonist and flautist, as well as composer and arranger. During a career spanning from the 1950s to the 2000s, Koffman was one of Canada's most prolific musicians, working variously in clubs and sessions and releasing 30 albums. With his 1957 record Cool and Hot Sax on the New York-based Jubilee label, Koffman became one of the first Canadian jazz mu

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter Ustinov, English-Swiss actor, director, producer, and screenwriter (b. 1921)

entities.title: Peter Ustinov
entities.description: Sir Peter Alexander von Ustinov was an English actor, writer, and filmmaker. He was a fixture on television talk shows and lecture circuits for much of his career. An intellectual and diplomat, he held various academic posts and served as a goodwill ambassador for UNICEF and president of the World Federalist Movement.

heading: Deaths
txt: Moura Lympany, English-Monacan pianist (b. 1916)

entities.title: Moura Lympany
entities.description: Dame Moura Lympany DBE was an English concert pianist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robin Spry, Canadian director, producer, and screenwriter (b. 1939)

heading: Deaths
txt: Pro Hart, Australian painter (b. 1928)

entities.title: Pro Hart
entities.description: Kevin Charles "Pro" Hart, MBE, was an Australian artist, born in Broken Hill, New South Wales, who was considered the father of the Australian Outback painting movement and his works are widely admired for capturing the true spirit of the outback. He grew up on his family's sheep farm in Menindee, New South Wales and was nicknamed "Professor" during his younger days, when he was known as an invent

heading: Deaths
txt: Vethathiri Maharishi, Indian philosopher and author (b. 1911)

heading: Deaths
txt: Charles Schepens, Belgian-American ophthalmologist and author (b. 1912)

heading: Deaths
txt: Caspar Weinberger, American captain, lawyer, and politician, 15th United States Secretary of Defense (b. 1917)

entities.title: United States Secretary of Defense
entities.description: The United States secretary of defense (SecDef) is the leader and chief executive officer of the United States Department of Defense, the executive department of the U.S. Armed Forces. The secretary of defense's position of command and authority over the military is second only to that of the president of the United States, who is the commander-in-chief. This position corresponds to what is genera

heading: Deaths
txt: Maurice Jarre, French-American composer and conductor (b. 1924)

entities.title: Maurice Jarre
entities.description: Maurice-Alexis Jarre was a French composer and conductor. Although he composed several concert works, Jarre is best known for his film scores, particularly for his collaborations with film director David Lean. txt: Didier Ratsiraka, Malagasy politician and naval officer (b. 1936)

entities.title: Didier Ratsiraka
entities.description: Didier Ignace Ratsiraka was a Malagasy politician and naval officer who was President of Madagascar from 1975 to 1993 and from 1997 to 2002. At the time of his death, he was the longest-serving President of Madagascar.

entities.title: Malagasy people
entities.description: The Malagasy are a mixed race ethnic group native to the island country of Madagascar. Their ancestry is the combination of continental African Bantu-speaking peoples who migrated from the Eastern coast of mainland Africa, and the Southeast Asian migrants of Austronesian stock, who migrated from Borneo and other islands of Indonesia of Maritime Southeast Asia.
